data.text: @LethalNatalia -- ease. There was no lock, no one was too keen on messing with him. "Make yourself at home or whatever." He removed what was left of his torn jacket, discarding it.

@LethalNatalia "Now that's something I'm glad to hear..." He pulled the bike to a stop, waiting for her to stand so he could get off. The dirt still flew in the air from their abrupt stop, as to be expected with Logan's style of driving. He walked towards the front door, opening it with --

@LethalNatalia -- certainly wasn't as much of a mess as him, not yet anyways. "Goddamn, this may be the longest drive either of us will ever have to endure." He said, trying to keep his eyes on the road.

@LethalNatalia He shot her a quick grin, "Not at all dear," the road started to become a bit bumpy, causing the car to jump around. "But you know, you seem to have gotten a few stains on that jumpsuit of yours yourself..." His eyes drifted to the blood stains on her black outfit. She --

@LethalNatalia -- Natashas leg as they rode. "It has been a /long/ day, hasn't it? Why don't we just stay the night at my place, save us a bit of driving." Despite all the commotion he was feeling quite motivated, probably the later part of an adrenaline rush.

@LethalNatalia He chuckled a bit at the heavily suggestive quip, watching her try and mask her amusement. It was getting rather dark, and he knew there was a cold six pack waiting for him back home. "My doors always open, darlin'." Speeding up a bit he ran a red light, putting his hand on --
@LethalNatalia going well over the speed limit and running red lights. He was a reckless driver to say the least.

@LethalNatalia There was probably something back home he could throw on, a button up flannel or another sleeveless top. The city was bustling as usual, traffic backed up with the sound of beeping cars and angry drivers. Of course Logan wasn't one to wait around, so he zipped between lanes, --

@LethalNatalia With a swift kick the bike started up, leaving a trail of exhaust behind as it quickly accelerated down the alley. Logan's clothes really were a mess, covered in bullet holes and splattered with red. Not that it was a real loss for him, he never spent much on what he wore. --

@LethalNatalia "What's left of em' anyway." He started picking the bullets from his quickly healing skin. "You staying here? Not sure I'd recommend it considering the mess we made." Retracting his claws he opened the door to the stairs. "Bikes still out back if you need a ride"
@LethalNatalia -- his hands. Certainly didn't help him sleep at night.

@LethalNatalia Familiar or soothing sights would obviously help to ease the hatred, but it wasn't always so easy. Logan looked around the bloodied room a bit. Of course this wasn't new to him, but it never really got any less frightening. Knowing that he'd done all of this. The blood was on --

@LethalNatalia "I'm fine... where are the hostages?" His breathing had slowed considerably, and he was returning to his more human state. This was normal, the spontaneous fluctuations in temperament. Over the years Logan had learned to more or less steer his anger, but not quite control it. --
@LethalNatalia -- his face. Of course he was left without a scratch, as if there was any doubt.

@LethalNatalia -- his body. As usual he'd painted the room red, spare limbs and broken weaponry sprawled across the floor. He was starting to see more clearly, again realizing /why/ he was tearing apart an army of angry men. "Well... I guess that's all of em'," he scoffed, wiping blood from --

@LethalNatalia By the time she was done with the hostages, not a soul remained standing but the gruff Canadian. He was steadily winding down after the massacre he'd just partook in. The rage was almost like simply blacking out for him, as if a totally different creature had control over --
@LethalNatalia -- "YOU WANT SOME? COME GET SOME THEN!" He was in a full berserker rage, mercilessly tearing men like tissue, howling like a wild predator.

@LethalNatalia -- wielding bats and knives charged in his direction. The beast had been set loose, tearing apart anyone, or thing, that got in its way. "HURRRAGGGHHH!!!" That signature animalistic battlecry echoed through the building, striking pure terror into his opponents. --

@LethalNatalia The next room was nothing but a flurry of blood, bullets, and screaming as Logan slashed and clawed his way through the hoards of armed gunman. His body soaked up bullets like a sponge, but his adrenaline was so fiery he couldn't feel them. Limbs flew around him and men --
@LethalNatalia -- to get a move on!" he shouted to the spy as bullets started flying in.

@LethalNatalia -- and he charged at the opposing wall howling his signature roar. The blades ran straight into an armed gunmans head, gunshots pouring in from the other room. Logan jumped out of the way and started through the nearby hallway as a means of flanking them. "You're gonna want --

@LethalNatalia "Long as you don't mind missing out on the fun part," he arched his neck to the side, making a cracking sound through his shoulder. His nostrils flared again as he searched for more nearby adversaries. "These guys wear too much cologne." With a *snikt* his claws shot back out, --

@LethalNatalia -- slowly removed his leather jacket, allowing the rest of the bullets to fall to the ground. Under he was wearing his usual sleeveless white top, tucked into some ragged jeans. "You didn't think we came all the way out here just to cut up some thugs did ya?"

@LethalNatalia "Oh we're not looking for an exit, not yet anyway." His body was riddled with bullets, mostly in the chest, some in the shoulder. He flexed a bit, forcing out the remaining shrapnel. "There's much more of em in here, and they've got hostages." The man grunted a bit as he --

@LethalNatalia -- his rage. "I think we're clear, for now," he wiped some blood off his cheek and retracted his claws. "I won't pretend I know where we're going, but I know we can't stay here. Someone was sure to of heard all that."

@LethalNatalia -- allowed him to easily smash through, throwing himself at the attackers. Without any hesitation, he slashed and hacked at the assailants, limbs flying and men screaming. He took a few bullets, but by now that didn't even faze him. Adrenaline was pumping through him, fueling --

@LethalNatalia "Thought you were better at the quiet part-" he quickly unsheathed his claws and stabbed into the wall, revealing three small beams of light from the room. His arm hooked inward as he dragged the blades along the vent, creating three lines. The weakness in that area --

@LethalNatalia "Ladies first," his right claws gestured towards the entry point. "I may be a little rough around the edges but I can still be a gentleman," he snickered. "Just... don't get caught, will ya? I'd be happy to take the lead once its time for the loud part."

@LethalNatalia "I don't know if I'd call em the best, but they get the job done." He quickly brought them up to the grate, his sharp claws piercing the cement and holding their weight. "Alright, you find a way to get that vent off. Got my hands full down here."
@LethalNatalia "Just hold on tight," he stabs the wall seemingly with ease, hoisting himself upward and buring his other set of claws on a slightly higher spot. "Like cutting through butter."

@LethalNatalia "Alright, I found an entrance. Small vent over there," he points up towards it. "They pained over it but eh, nothing I can't handle." He drops the cigar and stamps it out with his black boot. Both of his hands raise up and two sets of metal claws shoot out with a *snikt*.
@LethalNatalia "Yup, all safe and cozy. Not sure about getting in there, unless you've got any bright ideas"
@LethalNatalia "Like hell." His eyes scanned the wall, looking for an entrance. An air duct or something like that, quiet wasn't really his speciality. "Fucking concrete castle."

@LethalNatalia They pulled into an alleyway behind a large grey building, the bike skidding to a stop. His nostrils flared up as he used his farel senses to detect any nearby activity. "Yup, they're here."

@LethalNatalia "We're still alive aren't we?" He shouted over the roaring wind. The bumpy dirt road soon turned to black concrete as they entered a bustling city. Logan weaved between traffic, barely avoiding knocking the mirrors off the nearby cars.

@LethalNatalia He chuckled a bit, "that's one word for it." As the bike went down the road it hit multiple rather large bumps, almost sending them airborne, yet Logan remained unfazed. They zoomed by dozens of trees and the occasional house or shop. Luckily the roads were relatively clear.

@LethalNatalia "Good grip you got there," he looked back at her out the corner of his eye and grinned. With a powerful thrust of his leg he started the bike, a cloud of exhaust fuming from the tailpipe. "I seem to have forgotten a helmet, never saw the use in one anyway."

@LethalNatalia "I'd be more worried about the local morgue," he took another puff from his cigar, and swung his leg over his black motorcycle. "The gang's four miles North of here. They've got a facility just for the occasion. Should make things easier on us."
@LethalNatalia -- little more in your forte, then switch to loud. You know, my thing.

@LethalNatalia "You're a lot of things Nat, but cheerleader ain't one of em." He lit a big cigar, puffing a cloud of smoke off to the side. "Supposed to be a lotta guys over there tonight, and a good couple of hostages to watch out for. Figured we could start quiet, something a --
